thread.title: 10 Chuck Bass Quotes That Will Make You Believe In Your Shot At Love This Year
thread.title_full: 10 Chuck Bass Quotes That Will Make You Believe In Your Shot At Love This Year

author: Alexa Mellardo
title: 10 Chuck Bass Quotes That Will Make You Believe In Your Shot At Love This Year
text:
Like Us On Facebook Like Us On Facebook 
Oh, Chuck Bass , the OG fuckboy who toyed with all of our young, still fragile hearts. 
Most “Gossip Girl” fans had a love/hate relationship with the guy. 
We despised his conniving, Basshole ways at first, then fell irrevocably in love with him when he transformed throughout the show. Giphy 
Charles Bartholomew ended up surprising us all, and was Chuck Bastard (a little nickname my gal pals and I liked to call him) no more. 
The New York City socialite grew up and stopped playing the cat and mouse game, all because Blair Waldorf happened to him. She was the love of his life, and he was, in turn, hers. 
Their love for each other was evident throughout the series, even when they both didn’t want to admit it. 
The swoon-worthy duo tied the knot in the show’s finale, leaving each and every one of our souls able to die happy. 
Throughout the show, the majority of us developed a real soft spot for Chuck Bass. Sure, we loved Nate Archibald, but Chuck was CHUCK. And let’s be real here: No one rocked a suit and tie like the Bass. 
His bowties are another important conversation, for another day. 
We saw that through his playboy shield he, too, had a heart of gold. 
Some guys may come off as guarded on the outside, but it’s just a wall. You don’t know what they’re going through that makes them like that until you take a walk in their shoes and give them a chance. 
So, as you’re putting yourself out there in the dating scene this year, here are 10 quotes from Chuck Bass that will make you believe in your shot at love. 
Because when it comes down to it, Chuck Bass is motivating AF. “I am so sorry for the pain I’ve caused you. And I know I can’t take it back, but I wanna try and make it up to you. Even if it takes me the rest of my life.” Warner Bros.
